byline.contributor: Conor Dougherty and Nick Wingfield contributed reporting, and Doris Burke contributed research.
byline.original: By NATASHA SINGER and MIKE ISAAC

abstract: Chan Zuckerberg Initiative LLC, which Facebook chief Mark Zuckerberg and his wife Dr Priscilla Chan have introduced to give away 99 percent of their fortune, brings attention to atypical but increasingly popular financial vehicle in philanthropy; limited liability company acts in part like corporation and in part like business partnership.
lead_paragraph: The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative founded by Mark Zuckerberg, and his wife, Dr. Priscilla Chan, is structured as a limited liability company, which will give the couple more flexibility in their giving.

headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg’s Philanthropy Uses L.L.C. for More Control
headline.print_headline: Zuckerberg’s Philanthropy Uses L.L.C. for More Control

snippet: The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative founded by Mark Zuckerberg, and his wife, Dr. Priscilla Chan, is structured as a limited liability company, which will give the couple more flexibility in their giving.
